comment.body:
Nice article.  One point of clarification: "There are always 4 copies of a file in existance on the network"  --> four is a minimum I think - depending on the popularity of the file. Still overall this leads to a massive amount of de-duplication of data that hypothetically may lead to a much lower cost of cloud storage.

A link to this article has also been posted on the safenet forum here:

https://forum.safenetwork.io/t/maidsafes-safe-network-vs-zeronet-fight/8068

Thanks :-)
